body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
@kubernetes/sig-storage-bugs 
/assign

**What happened**:
[Testgrid](https://k8s-testgrid.appspot.com/sig-storage#gce-serial)
[Logs](https://k8s-gubernator.appspot.com/build/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/ci-kubernetes-e2e-gci-gce-serial/3273)

The regular volume mount didn't get cleaned up:
```
/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/storage/subpath.go:265
Expected grep stdout to be empty (i.e. no mount found).
Expected
    <string>: /dev/sdc on /var/lib/kubelet/pods/d98b92b4-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002/volumes/kubernetes.io~gce-pd/pvc-d98a660c-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002 type ext4 (rw,relatime,data=ordered)
    /dev/sdc on /var/lib/kubelet/pods/d98b92b4-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002/volumes/kubernetes.io~gce-pd/pvc-d98a660c-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002 type ext4 (rw,relatime,data=ordered)
    /dev/sdc on /home/kubernetes/containerized_mounter/rootfs/var/lib/kubelet/pods/d98b92b4-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002/volumes/kubernetes.io~gce-pd/pvc-d98a660c-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002 type ext4 (rw,relatime,data=ordered)
    /dev/sdc on /home/kubernetes/containerized_mounter/rootfs/var/lib/kubelet/pods/d98b92b4-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002/volumes/kubernetes.io~gce-pd/pvc-d98a660c-3bf7-11e8-8908-42010a800002 type ext4 (rw,relatime,data=ordered)
    
to be empty
/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/storage/subpath.go:615
```

@jingxu97 took a look, seems like the volume did get cleaned up after the check, so looks like there's some new delay introduced in the cleanup path.  Likely suspect is https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/61071, although it was merged almost a month ago, and this test only started failing 3 days ago.

Anyway, looks like the normal non-subpath test added an extra sleep to account for this delay.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Storage.
labels.name: sig/storage

title: Subpath graceful pod delete e2e test failing for gce pd
